meanings.definition: A pointed metal tool used for splicing rope.
meanings.sent1: The sailor used a marlinespike to splice the rope together.
meanings.sent2: The marlinespike is essential for working with thick ropes on the ship.
meanings.sent3: When the marlinespike went missing, the crew had a hard time fixing the ropes.
meanings.sent4: The marlinespike pierced through the tough rope like a hot knife through butter.
meanings.sent5: The shiny marlinespike gleamed in the sunlight as it worked its magic on the rope.

meanings.definition: To untwist or separate strands of rope using a marlinespike.
meanings.sent1: The sailor carefully marlinespiked the tangled rope to fix it.
meanings.sent2: It is important to marlinespike the rope before attempting to tie a knot.
meanings.sent3: The crew laughed as the sailor tried to marlinespike the rope with his eyes closed.
meanings.sent4: She marlinespiked through the problem, finding a solution in no time.
meanings.sent5: With a swift motion, he marlinespiked the rope, untangling it effortlessly.

meanings.definition: A knot used to secure the end of a rope.
meanings.sent1: The marlinespike knot held the rope securely in place.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to tie a tight marlinespike to prevent the rope from slipping.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull tried to untie the marlinespike knot for fun.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a well-tied marlinespike, keeping everyone in line.
meanings.sent5: The marlinespike knot was so strong, it could withstand even the strongest winds.
